Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Willdan Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: WLDN) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $42.85 (Yahoo Finance, as of market close Oct 11, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $492.3 million (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 11, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $16.80 - $45.45  
**Avg. Daily Volume:** 78,000 shares  

## Company Overview (187 words)
Willdan Group, Inc. (WLDN) is a provider of professional technical and consulting services, specializing in energy efficiency, renewable energy, engineering, and municipal outsourcing services. Founded in 1964 and headquartered in Anaheim, California, the company serves utilities, public agencies, private industry, and federal government clients across North America. Its core offerings focus on helping clients achieve energy savings, infrastructure resiliency, and regulatory compliance amid the energy transition.

Willdan operates through two main segments: Energy (73% of Q2 2024 revenue), delivering efficiency programs, demand response, renewables integration, and EV infrastructure; and Engineering & Consulting (27%), providing water, transportation, and facilities engineering. The company leverages data analytics, engineering expertise, and turnkey implementation to deliver measurable ROI for clients.

With ~2,800 employees, Willdan has capitalized on U.S. infrastructure spending (e.g., IIJA, IRA) and decarbonization trends. In FY2023, it reported record revenue of $578M (up 22% YoY), driven by federal grants and utility contracts. Recent momentum includes a robust backlog exceeding $500M (as of Q2 2024), positioning it for sustained growth in a fragmented $100B+ engineering services market.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Aug 1, 2024)**: Revenue $180.2M (+24% YoY), gross profit $44.1M (24.5% margin, up from 23.1%), net income $9.3M (EPS $0.87 vs. $0.40 YoY), adjusted EBITDA $17.5M (9.7% margin). Backlog $542M (+15% QoQ). Guidance raised for FY2024 revenue to $725-765M and adj. EBITDA $60-64M (Seeking Alpha transcript).
- **Major Contract Wins (Sep-Oct 2024)**: $48M California utility energy efficiency deal (Sep 2024); $30M federal resiliency project (Oct 2024 press release); total new awards ~$150M in H2 2024 YTD.
- **Insider Buying**: CEO purchased 10,000 shares at $35 on Aug 5, 2024 (SEC Form 4).
- **Analyst Coverage**: H.C. Wainwright initiated Buy rating with $50 PT (Sep 2024); Roth MKM raised PT to $45 (Aug 2024 post-earnings).

## Growth Strategy
- **Organic Expansion**: Prioritize high-margin federal/utility work; invest in digital tools (e.g., AI-driven energy modeling) for 10-15% annual revenue growth.
- **Backlog Conversion**: Target 25-30% YoY backlog growth to $700M+ by YE2024.
- **M&A Pipeline**: $50-100M deployable cash for tuck-ins in resiliency/water sectors (CEO comments, Q2 call).
- **Geographic Push**: Expand into Texas/Northeast via IRA-funded clean energy programs.

## Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Record backlog; 24% Q2 revenue growth; margin expansion to 9.7% adj. EBITDA. | Labor shortages in engineering talent; project delays from permitting (Q2 call). |
| **Sector (Engineering/Energy Consulting)** | IIJA/IRA funding ($1T+ opp.); decarbonization demand (utilities targeting 80% clean energy by 2030); EV/renewables boom. | Interest rate sensitivity (delays capex); election risk on green subsidies (Nov 2024). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Energy Segment**: Program management for efficiency rebates, demand-side management, LED retrofits, solar PV integration, EV charging.
- **Engineering & Consulting**: Civil/transportation engineering, water/wastewater treatment, disaster recovery planning.
- Key Revenue Drivers: 50%+ from utilities (e.g., PG&E, SoCal Edison), 30% federal (DOE, DoD).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Resiliency Suite (launched Q1 2024)**: Microgrid design and wildfire mitigation; $20M pipeline.
- **AI Analytics Platform**: Predictive energy savings tool (pilot with 2 utilities, Q3 2024 rollout).
- **EV Infrastructure Expansion**: $100M+ in planned federal grants for charger deployment (target H1 2025).

## Market Share and Forecast
- **Current Market Share**: ~1-2% in $120B U.S. engineering services (ENR rankings); #15 in energy efficiency consulting (Verdantix 2024 report).
- **Forecast**: +200-300 bps gain to 2.5-3% by 2026 via federal wins; 15-20% CAGR revenue outpacing sector 5-7% (mgmt. guidance, backlog supports).

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric (TTM as of Q2 2024) | WLDN | Tetra Tech (TTEK) | AECOM (ACM) | Stantec (STN.TO) |
|----------------------------|------|-------------------|-------------|------------------|
| **Revenue** | $593M | $4.2B | $14.2B | $4.2B |
| **Adj. EBITDA Margin** | 10.3% | 12.5% | 8.2% | 11.8% |
| **Backlog** | $542M (0.9x rev) | $5.1B (1.2x) | $40B (2.8x) | $7.5B (1.8x) |
| **YTD Stock Perf.** | +120% | +45% | +25% | +30% |
| **EV/EBITDA** | 8.2x | 22x | 14x | 16x |

*WLDN trades at discount to peers on growth/valuation; higher organic growth (22% vs. peers 10-15%).*

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: DOE for IRA grants; Siemens for smart grid tech (renewed Jul 2024).
- **M&A**: Acquired 360 Energy Group (Jan 2024, $10M, adds efficiency software); no major since.
- **Current Major Clients**: PG&E (15% revenue), SCE, federal (GSA, USACE ~25%).
- **Potential Clients**: Entergy, Duke Energy (bidding $200M pipeline); DoD microgrid expansions.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG Strength**: Carbon-neutral ops since 2022; 95% client retention.
- **Management**: CEO Keith Bryant (since 2017) drove 5x revenue growth; aligned incentives (35% insider ownership).
- **Risks**: Customer concentration (top 10 = 40%); cyclical federal spending.
- **Online Sentiment**: Bullish on Seeking Alpha/StockTwits (4.5/5 rating); Twitter buzz on backlog beats.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating: 8/10 (Strong Buy)**  
  Rationale: Exceptional growth (24% rev, backlog inflection), undervalued vs. peers (8x EV/EBITDA on 20% CAGR), tailwinds from IRA/IIJA outweigh risks. Moderate risk via diversified backlog, insider buys. Outperforms sector amid energy transition.
- **Estimated Fair Value: $55**  
  (DCFF model: 18% IRR on FY2025E EBITDA $70M at 10x multiple + backlog premium; 28% upside from $42.85). Suitable for growth portfolios targeting 20%+ annual returns. Hold if risk-averse pre-election.
